LanguageData.JRWOphiacodonReconstruct.label: Ophiacodon
LanguageData.JRWOphiacodonReconstruct.description:
-- > INGEN INTERNAL CASE FILE #02019-1878 [OPHIACODON MIRUS] CODENAME: SNAKE-TOOTH >492
A basal synapsid very close to the evolutionary chain leading up to mammals. Ophicodons true nature was rather speculative, with some arguing for a terrestrial lifestyle while others believe the creature was more suited to a amphibious lifestyle instead. Their jaws are lined with razor sharp, needle like teeth, perfect for gnawing up small lizards, tetrapods and amphibians.
